Name: Roser's Wharf
Description:
The Rose-Market caters to collectors and eccentrics - anyone with exotic tastes and the gumption to harass zee-captains. 

According to the arcane, archaic rules of the market, you can only make one trade per visit. Choose wisely. [People at the Rose-Market will pay above the usual price for specific goods.]

DefaultEvent.Name: "How much? What - for this? Allow me me explain a fundamental principle of economics..."
DefaultEvent.Description: He argues over the cost, the box's condition, and whether the wood is walnut, poplar or elm. Then he shakes your hand enthusiastically and happily pays every penny of your original price. A pair of market attendants, puffing beneath their unwieldy horse-masks, help him carry it away.

ChildBranches.Name: A Jovial Contrarian is purchasing Long-Boxes
ChildBranches.Description: His wheeled chair squeaks through the crowd. As all visitors to the Rose-Market must, he carries a mirror. He's painted over the glass, though, with the face of a bat.

DefaultEvent.Name: A satisfied customer
DefaultEvent.Description: "It makes admirable jewellery," she explains, "but exceptional tea." Two of the market's horse-masked attendants help her wheel the box away.

ChildBranches.Name: A Tattooed Courier will pay well for a consignment of Scintillack
ChildBranches.Description: Her skin is crowded with bright ink. Her smile is cocky.

DefaultEvent.Name: Great and terrible
DefaultEvent.Description: Shoshana holds a mirror over her pot of tea. The steam fogs the glass. As is market tradition, you write your information into the condensation with a finger. When you have finished, there is a rustling beneath her scarves; a wrinkled hand emerges from the silk, and places a fat envelope next to the tea pot. "For the knowledge; and your silence."

ChildBranches.Name: Madame Shoshana is seeking an Extraordinary Implication
ChildBranches.Description: The fortune-teller - under her many scarves - sips tea in a quiet corner of the market. She'll pay well for something portentous.

DefaultEvent.Name: Feeding the soul
DefaultEvent.Description: With his proceeds, he could dine frugally for a fortnight, sensibly for a week, or on Solacefruit for supper. He takes a tiny, careful nibble as soon as you hand it over, careful not to spill a drop of juice.

ChildBranches.Name: A Starving Poet is looking for Solacefruit
ChildBranches.Description: "I sold a sonnet!" he exclaims, jangling a pocketful of echoes.

DefaultEvent.Name: A step ahead
DefaultEvent.Description: You breathe against the glass of a display cabinet, and the Bespectacled Visitor scribbles down the words you trace into the condensation. Candle-light flashes in his dark glasses as he tucks the note into his breast pocket. "Understood. Thank you." He sits a heavy purse on the cabinet, and leaves without another word.

ChildBranches.Name: A Bespectacled Visitor will pay to learn Moves in the Great Game
ChildBranches.Description: He drags his thumb over his thick moustache and nods.

DefaultEvent.Name: A collector, of sorts
DefaultEvent.Description: The Veteran Privy Counsellor holds a mirror behind the artefact, and examines the reflection. "Hm. Yes. Inferior to London workmanship, obviously, but it will make an acceptable conversation piece nevertheless." He snaps his fingers at a servant. "Pay the captain."

ChildBranches.Name: The Veteran Privy Counsellor is seeking an Outlandish Artefact
ChildBranches.Description: He is there surveying curios from distant ports, with palace servants in muted slippers (the Empress dislikes loud noises).

DefaultEvent.Name: A satisfactory exchange
DefaultEvent.Description: "They make good chess-pieces," he says. He examines the figure's glaring eyes and clenched, bead-sized fists. "I think I'll use this one as a bishop."

ChildBranches.Name: The Honey-Addled Detective is collecting Watchful Curios
ChildBranches.Description: Nearby, a puppet-theatre is performing The Gardens of the Serpent. The Detective watches idly while waiting for sellers.

DefaultEvent.Name: His eyes light up. "Ah! I've heard of this captain..."
DefaultEvent.Description: The Baronet would never abandon his gloomy, ivied marsh-mansion. But on long evenings, he lights a candle and reads accounts of reckless nautical adventures. Then he closes the book, shakes his head, and commends his own good sense.

ChildBranches.Name: A Prim Baronet is looking for an Unread Log
ChildBranches.Description: He brushes black rose-petals from his shoes. The wharf is strewn with them whenever the Rose-Market congregates.

DefaultEvent.Name: Room in her heart
DefaultEvent.Description: "I never did like to see anything locked up." She searches her purse for payment, as two of her burlier supporters heft the cage. The thing inside is remarkably still. The Dauntless Temperance Campaigner hands over the fee, and pats the cage. "Come now, dearie. Let's get you out of here."

ChildBranches.Name: A Dauntless Temperance Campaigner is purchasing Live Specimens
ChildBranches.Description: She comes here to protest against the shadow-puppet production of The Honey Harvest, but she's also known to buy caged specimens.

DefaultEvent.Description: Puppet plays press on uninterrupted. Personal collections grow. Words written in fogged mirrors are hastily wiped away. The exotic exchanges pollinate dreams.

ChildBranches.Name: Escort some interested acquaintances to the Rose-Market
ChildBranches.Description: They hope to make a satisfying trade. [This will usher in a new day at the Rose-Market, and perhaps new buyers.]
